law.catch_line: Unlawful compensation for assistance in public matters.

text.section:
A person is guilty of unlawful compensation for assistance in public matters when:
While a public servant, he solicits, accepts or agrees to accept compensation for advice or other assistance in preparing a bill, contract, claim or other transaction or proposal as to which he knows that he is likely to have an official discretion to exercise; or
He offers, pays or agrees to pay compensation to a public servant for advice or other assistance in preparing or promoting a bill, contract, claim or other transaction with knowledge that acceptance by the public servant is unlawful.
Unlawful compensation for assistance in public matters is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 185, effective January 1, 1975.
